comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: "President is just 'Tommy' for a day" --New York Times, June 14, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F7091FF73C5E13... U. S. President Thomas Woodrow Wilson had declined special recognition during his visit to Princeton, either as President of the U. S., or as former president of Princeton University -- deciding instead that he simply wanted to march around the campus with fellow members of the Princeton Class of 1879, which was observing its 35th anniversary with a reunion during Princeton's commencement week.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: LOC -- your caption to the photo is incorrect. Bain's minions placed the "X" on the negative merely to indicate Wilson's position in the photo -- the "X" is above his head, more or less. Although he was the ex-president of Princeton University, he was not, in 1914, the ex-President of the United States.

comment.author: 35607158@N06
comment._content: But he was the ex-President of Princeton.
